intro: Lallemantia peltata, commonly known as the broadleaf lantana, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as stream banks and woodland edges. It produces fragrant, tubular flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Lallemantia peltata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
